product_name: Drunk ElephantUmbra Mineral Cream SPF 30 Tinted Face Sunscreen
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingHSA/FSA eligibleDrunk Elephant Umbra Mineral Cream SPF 30 Tinted Face Sunscreen is a smooth, lightweight, 100% mineral sunscreen that delivers powerful SPF 30/PA+++ protection. Available in three sheer, skin compatible colors.
details: DetailsBenefitsPotent antioxidants, such as astaxanthin, tetrahexyldecyl ascorbate, and ubiquinone, help enhance skin's free radical defensesPlant oils nourish skinNon-pilling and highly blendableDelivers 100% mineral sun protection that is ideal for daily use on all skin - even sensitiveDermatologist TestedKey Ingredients20% Zinc Oxide: Mineral sunscreen active that provides broad-spectrum (UVA and UVB) protection.Astaxanthin: Derived from seaweed, known to provide powerful antioxidant benefits.Tetrahexyldecyl Ascorbate: A form of vitamin C; has the potential to improve signs of aging and uneven skin tone.Research ResultsIn a consumer-perception study of 55 people after 2 weeks:92% agreed the product felt gentle on skin92% agreed the product applied smoothly and evenly90% agreed the product did not pill while blending into skinItem 2622999How To UseEvery morning, apply evenly to your face as the last step in your skincare routine and to prep your skin for whatever comes next.Don't forget to apply to your ears, neck, chest, and backs of hands - they need sun protection, too.IngredientsActive: Zinc Oxide 20.0%.Inactive: Water, Ethylhexyl Olivate, Squalane, C9-12 Alkane, Propanediol, Polyglyceryl-3 Diisostearate, Glycerin, Polyglyceryl-6 Polyricinoleate, Silica, Disteardimonium Hectorite, Lauroyl Lysine, Kaolin, Sclerocarya Birrea Seed Oil, Camellia Sinensis Seed Oil, Coco-Caprylate/Caprate, Rubus Idaeus (Raspberry) Seed Oil, Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, Acacia Senegal Gum, Silybum Marianum Fruit Extract, Tetrahexyldecyl Ascorbate, Vitis Vinifera (Grape) Juice Extract, C12-15 Alkyl Benzoate, Haematococcus Pluvialis Extract, Ubiquinone, Astaxanthin, Dextrin, Sea Water, Brassica Campestris (Rapeseed) Seed Oil, Tocopheryl Acetate, Potassium Sorbate, Chlorphenesin, Sea Salt, Sodium Benzoate, Tetrasodium Glutamate Diacetate, Phenoxyethanol, Sodium Hydroxide, Tocopherol, Iron Oxides.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Every morning, apply evenly to your face as the last step in your skincare routine and to prep your skin for whatever comes next.Don't forget to apply to your ears, neck, chest, and backs of hands - they need sun protection, too.

reviews.headline: Grainy Formula
reviews.comments: I do like the color of this sunscreen. It gives the skin a nice tint and hides minor blemishes. However, the texture is awful. It's so gritty. I have not been able to get over it. I used up about half the bottle and ended up throwing it away.

reviews.headline: Hurts my face
reviews.comments: I love the color of this product, the fact that it is actually 100% mineral (no hidden chemicsl filters) like most sunscreens and that it is 2oz vs 1.7oz. However, this is suppsoed to go on smooth but when I rub it in initially or even during the day, it is gritty. Assuming its the sea salt in the formula. Why even put this in? You dont need it. There is no necessary benefit to it and ruins the product. I bought this despite the other reviews stating this and now im disappointed. Should have listened!

reviews.headline: I love the tint but makes me breakout
reviews.comments: I bought this product hoping to use it instead of concealer for the summer time and for the first couple if days it worked really well. The problem was after a week of using it my skin began to break out. It may be because I have more of a oily skin type that caused the issue but after not having it on for a couple of days my skin went back to normal.

reviews.headline: Clinique is better
reviews.comments: I bought thus because it was being talked about everywhere. Definitely overhyped. I like the Clinique City Sunblock better. Color, effectiveness, overall feel. Drunk Elephant isn't it for me.

reviews.headline: Favorite mineral sunscreen
reviews.comments: This formula is perfect. I wear it daily. It makes my skin glow! Good to use alone or under makeup. Doesnt clog pores. Will always have on hand.

reviews.headline: Disappointed
reviews.comments: I never write reviews but I have loved all of Drunk Elephant's products so far, and live on the bronze and glow drops. I was so excited for this product but found it goes on thick, feels heavy and doesn't blend well or have good coverage. Save your money!

reviews.headline: Pulls Your Face
reviews.comments: I was so excited that this brand has a tinted SPF but I got it and it was the worst SPF I've ever used. It is SO THICK and drying that I have to mix it with moisturizer for it to spread across my face. I will not be purchasing  this product again unfortunately.

reviews.headline: So bad...
reviews.comments: I wanted to love this.  It does have a weird grit when you first put it on, but that really wasn't the deal-breaker.  This stuff makes my face feel sticky/greasy.  It's also really hard to get off my hands after I've applied it to my face.

reviews.headline: One of the best True Mineral Sunscreens
reviews.comments: All ingredients are good. Moisturizing, feels great knowing and trusting the ingredients won't give me a rash. If it is chilly in morning I do rub between my warm fingers and lather across my face. When I reapply after 2 hours, it glides on over without being oily, grainy or cakey. The 3rd reapplication is good and not thick. But have to wash face before the 4th reapplication. I highly recommend for those with sensitive skin or a true Mineral Sunscreen. No fragrance which I love.

reviews.headline: Love this sunscreen
reviews.comments: This is the best sunscreen i have used in the last several years. Everything breaks me out & burns my eyes. This hasnt done with of those things. Goes on smooth and can be worn like a BB cream.

reviews.headline: Horrible
reviews.comments: One of the worst products ever. Cannot get passed the texture, it feels like rubbing sand on your face and is so grainy and patchy. I returned it right after trying it.

reviews.headline: Smooth, clean feeling on skin
reviews.comments: This feels like a moisturizer on my skin. I don't mind putting it on like others that feel thick or like foundation. It's refreshing, smooth easy to blend.  I've been using it since the new tint came out.  I don't want to use my more expensive one anymore.

reviews.headline: Did not get burned but‚Ä¶
reviews.comments: I got this in the color tinted and wore it while on spring break in Disney but it is very gritty. I had to use a makeup brush to blot it on bc it felt like rubbing sand on my face.

reviews.headline: Very Underwhelming
reviews.comments: I'm very, very fair skinned. This leaves a white cast on me, which has never happened in my life. The texture is weirdly gritty, and it's quite oily after dry down and not in a cute way. It settles into my laugh lines throughout the day and I have to keep rubbing it in. Can't get out any that gets on my eyebrows so I have brow flakes all day. I use a ton of different face sunscreens and especially for the price, this is awful sunscreen.

reviews.headline: I wanted to love this but it's GRITTY
reviews.comments: I use the translucent version of this regularly and wanted to use this as well but its very gritty and oily. The color is good but I rarely wear it.

reviews.headline: Didn't love it, didn't hate it
reviews.comments: Got the color Tinte which I think was nice for my olive-y skin. I feel like I have dry to normal skin and I just did not like the texture of this Drunk Elephant spf. It felt very heavy... almost like a tar, really cakey. I always seem to put on too much or not enough. I felt as though it was hard to blend in, despite what other's have written. I think that it is worth trying out, maybe at the store first as a tester. I really like my other DE products and so I was hoping to like this. I will stick to my preferred B*liss tinted spf sunscreen.

reviews.headline: So disappointed
reviews.comments: This was my first Drunk Elephant product and i am so upset! I was looking for a smooth tinted spf. This feels like a scrub mask. Threw it in the trash

reviews.headline: Very Nice, But‚Ä¶
reviews.comments:
I really really like this subscreen- giving it five starts since 4.5 isnt an option. Im very pale and got the pink tint, and it blends in very vell considering it is a mineral sunscreen. So long as you rub it in well enough there isnt a cast. But, whenever i fist gonoutside or in direct sunlight after applying, there is an immediate and strange smell from the sunscreen.
But this is very nice and very gentle on my skin which is acne lrone and very sensitive. I always put moistuoriser in before the sunscreen beachse if my dry skin, and that way there is no pilling.

reviews.headline: Terrible
reviews.comments: Apparently this is a new formula? It's awful. It's super gritty and feels scratchy when you're blending it on your face.

reviews.headline: Natura Bisse dupe Ôøº
reviews.comments: IMO this is almost an exact dupe of Natura bissa's sunscreen tint which is $100+ & I cant bring myself to buy it (I've only had samples). This product leaves your skin super dewy and lasts. I live in colorado so counteracting the dry climate is first & foremost in my skin care routine. This product does the trick!

faceoff_positive.comments:
When it comes to sunscreen, I'm all about formulas that are effective but also a joy to wear‚Äîand Drunk Elephant's Umbra Sheer Mineral Sunscreen SPF 30 is just that. This 100% mineral sunscreen promises high-performance sun protection (SPF 30/PA+++), while keeping the formula clean and simple. And let me tell you, it definitely lives up to its claims!

Let's talk texture and feel first: this mineral sunscreen is incredibly lightweight and smooth. Often with mineral formulas, you get that dreaded chalky or heavy finish, but Umbra Sheer goes on so seamlessly. It's sheer with a touch of light pink tint, which works wonders to help tone down any visible signs of the zinc oxide without looking like you're wearing anything at all. Plus, it blends like a dream without pilling‚Äîso it's a winner even under makeup.

Another thing I love is the antioxidant boost in this formula. It's packed with skin-loving ingredients like astaxanthin, tetrahexyldecyl ascorbate, and ubiquinone that protect against free radicals. Combined with nourishing plant oils, this sunscreen goes beyond just protecting from UV rays; it's essentially skincare in a sunscreen bottle. My skin feels as if it's getting a gentle hydration boost throughout the day.

I have sensitive skin, and I've had zero irritation with this product. Often, mineral sunscreens can be tricky if you're sensitive, but Drunk Elephant has nailed it here. I can confidently use it daily, knowing it's giving me the protection I need without any discomfort. I also love that it's available in multiple shades‚Äîjust another way Drunk Elephant is making suncare accessible to everyone.
faceoff_positive.headline: A shear delight for sensitive skin

faceoff_negative.comments:
This is the first drunk elephant product I have ever used and I purchased this myself with my own money from ulta in the shade cocoa and I'm conflicted. I do feel like, color wise, it's one of the best mineral sunscreens i have ever tried. I don't feel like it leaves a white cast and it blends pretty decently into my skin tone. You can still tell there's a little something on my face because it does look a tiny bit pale by itself, but if you put a little powder over it, it looks great. 

The pictures I include have my plain face, a swatch, the product not fully blended, the product blended, and the product with powder over it. For reference I'm the shade nw48 in mac studio fix powder plus foundation / 21 in fenty eaze drops. 

In addition, it does not burn my skin or eyes. I wore it all day on my face, including directly on my eyelids and I did not feel any irritation on my eyes at all, which I normally feel with sunscreens. I had an itch or two on my face, but that's normal for me. The main thing I look for is burning and my skin did not feel like it was burning at all, which as someone with sensitive skin, I appreciate that. Moreover, so many products have hyaluronic acid these days, and my skin is sensitive to that, so I also appreciate that this product does not have that in it.  

The thing I don't like about this product is the texture and difficulty blending. It has a grainy texture that does not feel good at all when you are putting it on. I'm not sure how to describe it, but the closest thing I can think of is, that it kind of feels like that st. Ives scrub we used to use back in the day, only not as bad. There are no visible beads in it or anything, but it has a gritty texture when you're rubbing it in, and I'm afraid it might be too harsh in the long run. I'm not sure if it's exfoliating my skin and I'm really working on repairing my skin barrier, so I'm unsure of how i feel about this product. I was on the fence about returning it, but I think i will probably keep it to see how I fair with continued used. 

Again, I like the color (for a mineral product) and the fact that it doesn't seem to irritate my skin throughout the day, but the texture when putting it on is just so off putting that I'm unsure about it, especially since it takes quite a bit of rubbing to get that decent blend with the skin. I would say I rubbed it in for a good 5 minutes to get this color that I think looks decent, and while I was rubbing it in, it looked streaky, so at the end, I pat it into my face to finish it off. And be warned that it is pretty messy. So don't wear something white or touch any white surfaces while you're rubbing it in because you defintely need to thoroughly wash your hands and get the product off before touching anything.

Still, I would say it's worth a try because, let's be honest, the mineral options for us darker skinned girls are limited, but I'm just not sure if I would repurchase it. I think I will keep it and use it up because I do like how it looks under my mac studio fix powder plus foundation. It looks very natural with a little powder over it, but on its own, and the texture while applying it makes me feel unsure about it.
faceoff_negative.headline: Unsure about it, but worth a try
